General Commands.description: Basic commands for getting help and information about the bot.

commands.name: help
commands.description: This allows users to find out more information on all of our commands.

Admin Commands.description: Administrative commands for server management and bot system control.

commands.name: bot-status
commands.description: Pushes an embed to display in the channel about a bot update
commands.example: /bot-status Fixed a bug in the help command

commands.name: disable-system
commands.description: Disables a bot system (suggestions, reports, thanks)

commands.name: dm
commands.description: Sends an official DM to a specified user

commands.name: enable-system
commands.description: Enables a bot system (suggestions, reports, thanks)

commands.name: server-status
commands.description: Pushes an embed to display in the channel about a server update
commands.example: /server-status New channels added for Python discussions

commands.name: site-status
commands.description: Pushes an embed to display in the channel about a website update

commands.name: sub-status
commands.description: Pushes an embed to display in the channel about a subreddit update
commands.example: /sub-status New rules added to the subreddit

commands.name: system-status
commands.description: Shows the status of all bot systems

Information Commands.description: Commands that provide helpful information and resources for developers.

commands.name: career
commands.description: Allows users to get information on how to get careers in the IT field.

commands.name: djs
commands.description: Sends an invite link to the Discord.js Discord Server

commands.name: ddev
commands.description: Sends a link to join the Discord Developers Discord Server

commands.name: djslangfirst
commands.description: Asks users to learn JavaScript before trying to learn Discord.js

commands.name: dom-listening
commands.description: Sends information about why not to use dom listening attributes/properties.

commands.name: dpy
commands.description: Sends an invite link to the Discord.py Discord Server.

commands.name: editors
commands.description: Sends information on commonly used IDEs or Text Editors.

commands.name: freelance
commands.description: Allows users to get information on how to self employment or freelancing.

commands.name: largehosting
commands.description: Sends information about hosting providers.

commands.name: nojquery
commands.description: Sends information on why JQuery isn't used and is bad to use.

commands.name: noscreens
commands.description: Sends information on why it is best to avoid sending screenshots of your code.

commands.name: react
commands.description: Sends an invite link to the Reactiflux Discord Server

commands.name: smallhosting
commands.description: This is a small snippet from our `/largehosting` command.

commands.name: vla
commands.description: Sends info on what a VLA is and why is it bad?

commands.name: w3c
commands.description: Informs our users why they should avoid w3schools like the plague.

commands.name: webassembly
commands.description: Sends an invite link to the Web Assembly Discord Server.

Message Issue Commands.description: Commands to help with common message formatting and communication issues.

commands.name: bin
commands.description: Tells people a few places they could go to share long pieces of code.

commands.name: elaborate
commands.description: Asks people to elaborate by including code or by including more information.

commands.name: error
commands.description: Tells people to post the full stack trace.

commands.name: faq
commands.description: Tells users to check out our FAQ channel and docs to get their simple questions answered.

commands.name: format
commands.description: Asks people to format their code with backticks or by sharing their code on places like pastebin.com

commands.name: gettinganswers
commands.description: Sends information on how to ask better questions.

commands.name: hire
commands.description: Refers people to the request-coders channel to hire someone.

commands.name: rules
commands.description: Asks users to make sure they are following the rules.
commands.usage: /rules @username or user ID rule number[1-5] or /rules @username or ID all

Utility Commands.description: General utility commands for server interaction and bot functionality.

commands.name: afk
commands.description: Set yourself as AFK with an optional message and duration. Your nickname will show (AFK) while away.

commands.name: afk-remove
commands.description: Manually remove your AFK status and restore your nickname.

commands.name: about
commands.description: Shows information about the bot including version and features.

commands.name: avatar
commands.description: Shows a user's avatar in full size.

commands.name: flip
commands.description: Flips a coin and returns heads or tails.

commands.name: invite
commands.description: Get an invite link to add this bot to your server.

commands.name: ping
commands.description: Shows the bot's latency and API response time.

commands.name: reddit
commands.description: Get a link to the r/OneNote subreddit.

commands.name: tech
commands.description: Shows the technology stack used by this bot.

commands.name: wiki
commands.description: Get a link to the OneNote documentation and wiki.
